data.sampled: 138. The 12/8 time signature means that the song has 12 beats per bar, and each beat is equal to one eighth note. This time signature is often used to create a relaxed, laid-back atmosphere, with a slow groove that has a lot of feel and emotion. The tempo of the song depends on the BPM, which can vary depending on the style of music being played. For example, a relaxed tempo of around 60 BPM can give a nice laid-back feel to the song, which can be comfortable for a wide range of rhythms and patterns. The time signature also influences the rhythm patterns and phrasing, which can be adjusted to fit the groove or meter of the song. The use of a 12/8 time signature is a common aspect of many popular music genres including rock, pop, and dance music. However, it is often associated with alternative, avant-garde, and fusion styles of music, which can be seen in tracks from artists such as Tool, Yes, Tame Impala, Phish, and many others.
